entityId.localType: State Records Authority of New South Wales Series Number

nameEntry.part: Miscellaneous Correspondence Files Relating To Immigrant Children [School Attendance/Licensing Branch, Department of Community Services]

biogHist.abstract:
Miscellaneous Correspondence Files Relating To Immigrant Children contain three files within the series. Two files concern correspondence with officials of the Big Brother and Dr Barnardo's schemes including information about immigration regulations and procedures. The third file relates to a District Officer's investigation of a complaint by a child sponsored by the Big Brother Scheme.
Quantity: 1 bundle
biogHist.p: Access to these records is restricted. People wishing to access restricted records can either contact their nearest Community Services Centre to apply or they can post the information; an application form must be completed together with proof of identity provided.

In New South Wales, records relating to individuals, such as case files and correspondence are closed to public access for 100 years. Records such as registers and indexes are closed to public access for 80 years. Individuals can apply to request access to records in this series.
